meanings.definition: Incapable of making mistakes or being wrong.
meanings.sent1: Her infallible memory always impressed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's infallible experiment results were admired by all.
meanings.sent3: Even the infallible computer sometimes crashes unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: His infallible sense of direction guided us through the maze of streets.
meanings.sent5: The infallible compass always pointed north, never failing.

meanings.sent1: The infallible plan led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent2: The infallible diamond sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: Her infallible aim in archery competitions amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The infallible logic of the argument left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: The infallible beauty of the sunset took our breath away.
